verses.text: Whoever loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof \add is\add* brutish.
A good \add man\add* obtaineth favor from the LORD: but a man of wicked devices he will condemn.
A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
A virtuous woman \add is\add* a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed \add is\add* as rottenness in his bones.
The thoughts of the righteous \add are\add* right: \add but\add* the counsels of the wicked \add are\add* deceit.
The words of the wicked \add are\add* to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
The wicked are overthrown, and \add are\add* not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
\add He that is\add* despised, and hath a servant, \add is\add* better than he that honoreth himself, and is destitute of bread.
A righteous \add man\add* regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked \add are\add* cruel.
He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain \add persons is\add* void of understanding.
The wicked desireth the net of evil \add men\add* : but the root of the righteous yieldeth \add fruit\add* .
The wicked is snared by the transgression of \add his\add* lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.
A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of \add his\add* mouth: and the recompense of a man's hands shall be rendered to him.
The way of a fool \add is\add* right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth to counsel \add is\add* wise.
A fool's wrath is presently known: but a prudent \add man\add* covereth shame.
\add He that\add* speaketh truth showeth forth righteousness: but a false witness, deceit.
There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise \add is\add* health.
The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue \add is\add* but for a moment.
Deceit \add is\add* in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counselors of peace \add is\add* joy.
There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.
Lying lips \add are\add* abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly \add are\add* his delight.
A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
Heaviness in the heart of man depresseth it: but a good word maketh it glad.
The righteous \add is\add* more excellent than his neighbor: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
The slothful \add man\add* roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man \add is\add* precious.
In the way of righteousness \add is\add* life; and \add in\add* the path \add of it there is\add* no death.
